document_type: ISO 27001 Security Requirements - Annex A Control
applies_to_note: All gambling operators subject to RTS Chapter 4 - Security Requirements who outsource system development or engage third-party developers

control.control_purpose: To ensure information security measures required by the organisation are implemented in outsourced system development through direction, monitoring and review
control.control_objective: Establish governance, contracts and monitoring processes to ensure outsourced developers meet organizational security requirements throughout development lifecycle

iso_27001_definition.official_text: The organisation should direct, monitor and review the activities related to outsourced system development.
key_requirements: Direction - communicate security requirements to outsourced developers
Monitoring - verify outsourced developers comply with requirements
Review - assess security of outsourced development
Contracts in place with security clauses
Due diligence on developer security posture

control_purpose_detail.purpose: Preventive and detective control ensuring outsourced developers implement required security measures and comply with organizational security requirements
scope: Any development activity outsourced to external parties
control_purpose_detail.key_outcome: Outsourced development activities meet organizational security requirements, vulnerabilities are identified before deployment, and third-party security risks are managed throughout the development lifecycle

required_prerequisites.description: Supplier relationship and risk management program in place

required_prerequisites.description: Security requirements defined for systems and applications

required_prerequisites.rationale: Outsourced developers expected to follow SDLC

outsourced_development_overview.definition: Engagement of external third-party developers to design, develop, test, and deploy systems on behalf of the organization with appropriate security governance and oversight
key_challenges: Limited visibility and control over development activities
Intellectual property and code ownership issues

ISO 27001 A 5.20 - Addressing information security within supplier agreements

implementation_requirements.requirement: Conduct Vendor Due Diligence and Selection
implementation_requirements.description: Evaluate potential outsourced developers for their security posture, capabilities and track record before engagement

due_diligence_process: Request security questionnaires from potential vendors
Verify claimed security certifications (ISO 27001, SOC 2, etc.)
Conduct background checks on vendor organization
Review of vendor security audit reports
Site visits to vendor facilities if applicable
risk_assessment: Assess criticality of system being developed
Evaluate vendor's ability to protect critical data
Identify potential security risks from vendor

implementation_requirements.requirement: Establish Comprehensive Contracts with Security Clauses
implementation_requirements.description: Include detailed security requirements and obligations in all contracts with outsourced developers

contract_elements: Scope of development work and deliverables
security_clauses: Developer shall comply with organization information security policy
Developer shall implement secure development practices
Developer shall conduct security testing before delivery
Developer shall provide evidence of testing and remediation
Developer shall maintain confidentiality of proprietary information
Developer shall comply with regulatory requirements
Developer shall notify of security incidents within specified timeframe
Organization has right to audit developer activities
Liability for security vulnerabilities discovered post-deployment
contract_governance: Legal counsel review of all contracts

implementation_requirements.description: Implement controls for sharing sensitive information with outsourced developers

information_sharing_controls: Data classification of information to be shared
Determine what sensitive information must be shared
Encryption of data in transit to developer
Limitation of data access to necessary personnel
Data retention and secure deletion procedures
Audit logging of all information sharing
access_controls: VPN or secure tunnels for remote access
data_loss_prevention: DLP tools to detect unauthorized data transfer

implementation_requirements.requirement: Ensure Data Protection and Privacy Compliance
implementation_requirements.description: Ensure compliance with data protection regulations when sharing data with outsourced developers

privacy_governance: Right to audit developer data handling
regulatory_compliance: GDPR compliance if EU data involved

implementation_requirements.description: Establish clear procedures for incident reporting and response with outsourced developers

incident_reporting_procedures: Information to be included in reports

implementation_requirements.description: Ensure outsourced developers maintain adequate physical and environmental security at their facilities

physical_security_requirements: Secure storage of equipment and documents
Secure disposal of equipment containing data
environmental_controls: Security of server rooms and data centers
verification_approach: Remote monitoring via cameras if applicable

implementation_requirements.description: Ensure outsourced developers have robust HR security practices for their personnel

onboarding_and_offboarding: Clear desk and clean desk policies

implementation_requirements.requirement: Verify System and Application Security Controls
implementation_requirements.description: Ensure outsourced developers implement robust system and application security controls

implementation_requirements.requirement: Verify Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery
implementation_requirements.description: Ensure outsourced developers have business continuity and disaster recovery capabilities
Implement ongoing monitoring and periodic auditing of outsourced developer activities

implementation_requirements.requirement: Manage Code Escrow and Intellectual Property
implementation_requirements.description: Establish escrow arrangements for critical code and manage intellectual property rights
Create formal framework for managing relationship with outsourced developers

common_mistakes.description: Top 3 mistakes organizations make with outsourced development management

mistakes.mistake: Inadequate contracts with weak or missing security requirements
mistakes.description: Contracts lack detailed security clauses, unclear responsibilities, and no audit rights, leaving organization without enforceable security obligations
root_cause: Cost or time pressure to complete contracting quickly
Lack of security involvement in contract development
Use of generic templates without customization
Poor legal counsel guidance on security requirements
Assumption vendor will handle security appropriately
Difficulty negotiating strong terms with vendors
impact: No contractual basis to enforce security requirements
Cannot demand audits or evidence of compliance
Vendor can claim security not required or agreed
No recourse if security failures occur
Vulnerable systems deployed with inadequate controls
prevention: Security team involved in all contract negotiations
Use security-specific contract templates
Include detailed security clauses in every contract
Legal counsel experienced in information security
Audit rights included in all contracts
SLAs for security metrics
Right to terminate for security violations
Regular contract reviews and updates
mistakes.requirement: Contracts must include comprehensive security requirements, audit rights, and enforcement mechanisms

mistakes.mistake: Lack of monitoring and auditing of outsourced developer compliance
mistakes.description: No ongoing monitoring or auditing of vendor compliance, assumptions developer is following requirements without verification
root_cause: Out of sight, out of mind mentality
No audit procedures or tools in place
impact: Vendor may not be complying with requirements
Security issues not discovered until deployment
Audit findings for inadequate third-party oversight
Security incidents resulting from vendor failures
prevention: Establish annual audit program with scheduled audits
Include monitoring responsibilities in vendor management
Define KPIs and metrics for vendor security performance
Implement automated monitoring where possible
Regular communication with vendor about security
Pre-deployment security validation required
Risk-based audit frequency (critical systems more often)

mistakes.mistake: Inadequate due diligence before vendor engagement
mistakes.description: Limited or no vendor evaluation, engaging developers without assessing security practices, leading to engagement with security-immature vendors
root_cause: Focus on cost rather than security
Assumption all vendors are equally secure
Small or new vendors lack certifications
impact: Engagement with vendors with poor security practices
Security requirements not understood or implemented
Risk of data breaches and compromise
prevention: Comprehensive vendor evaluation process
Security requirements in vendor selection criteria
Request and verify security certifications
Vendor security questionnaire completion
Reference checks with existing customers
On-site visits for critical vendors
Risk assessment of vendor security practices
Periodic re-evaluation of vendor security

ukgc_application.critical_systems_context: For gambling operators, outsourced development of RNG systems, game outcomes, customer data systems, and payment processing represents the highest security risk. Inadequate third-party oversight can result in compromised game integrity, customer data breaches, and regulatory violations.

outsourced_requirements: Vendor must have demonstrated RNG development expertise
Independent RNG validation and testing required
Source code escrow mandatory for RNG
GDPR and UK Data Protection Act compliance

vendor_management_for_gambling.guidance: Due diligence must assess vendor's experience with gambling systems, understanding of regulatory requirements, security maturity, and track record with similar operators.

Contracts must include specific security requirements for gambling systems, right to conduct independent audits and penetration testing, liability for regulatory violations, and source code escrow for critical systems.
Require comprehensive security testing including penetration testing by independent testers qualified in gambling system security before any deployment.
More frequent auditing for gambling-critical systems (quarterly or semi-annual), with focus on game integrity, RNG security, and compliance controls.
Rapid incident reporting required (within hours for security incidents), with defined escalation to regulatory authority if needed.

regulatory_expectations: Clear vendor selection and evaluation process

mitigation: Segregation of work and access controls
Right to audit for conflicts of interest

high_risk_vendor_scenarios.scenario: Small or new vendor with limited experience

rng_vendor_management.guidance: Engage only vendors with demonstrated expertise in RNG development. Require evidence of cryptography qualifications and previous RNG implementations.
Require independent RNG validation by qualified experts. Do not rely solely on vendor testing. Engage independent labs or auditors.
Mandatory source code escrow for any outsourced RNG development. Ensures access to code if vendor fails or relationship ends.
Unrestricted audit rights including code review, testing procedures, and mathematical validation. Right to engage independent auditors at any time.

game_system_vendor_management.guidance: Contracts must require game outcome integrity controls, tamper detection, and audit trail completeness. Testing must validate outcome recording accuracy.
Vendor must understand gambling regulatory requirements including RTS Chapter 4. Experience with UK gambling systems preferred.
Comprehensive security testing including penetration testing by qualified testers. Test for game manipulation and outcome tampering.

payment_system_vendor_management.guidance: Vendor must be PCI DSS Level 1 compliant or equivalent. Annual audits verifying compliance required.
Strong encryption, secure key management, and secure payment processing. No storage of sensitive payment data.
Regular penetration testing of payment systems. Vulnerability scanning required.

customer_data_vendor_management.guidance: GDPR and UK Data Protection Act compliance mandatory. Data Processing Agreements required. Enhanced controls for personal data.
Encryption of personal data, secure backup and recovery, and secure deletion procedures. Access restricted to necessary personnel.
Regular audits of vendor data handling practices. Incident reporting for any data breaches.
